subject: RHUM
name: Intro to Sci/Tech Comm Major
fullname: Introduction to the Major of Scientific and Technical Communication
info: History of technical communication, its connection to rhetoric. Technical writing, speaking, multimedia, and their applications in science/technology fields (e.g., health science, computer science, agriculture). Portfolios, professional organizations, publications. Guest speakers, discussion, activities.

subject: RHUM
name: Gender/Rhetoric of Sci/Tech
fullname: Gender and the Rhetoric of Science and Technology
info: How cultural gender roles are affected by science/technology. Influence of gender roles on scientific/technological thinking (e.g., communication strategies, language, image). Values/goals of past/present scientific technological communities.

subject: RHUM
name: Theories: Human Communication
fullname: Theories of Human Communication
info: Through lecture, discussion, simulations, and small group work students become familiar with theories and practices of interpersonal, small group, organizational, and scientific, and technical communication.

subject: RHUM
name: Scientific/Tech Presentation
fullname: Scientific and Technical Presentations
info: Oral presentation skills for scientific or technical topics. Visual communication, audience analysis, organizing a presentation, presenting complex material. Emphasizes use of computers.

subject: RHUM
name: Group Process: Team Leadership
fullname: Group Process, Team Building, and Leadership
info: Group processes, team building from perspective of managers/leaders. Communication techniques in small group decision making process. Theories of team/small-group communication. Case studies. Group project for each student.

subject: RHUM
name: Special Topics
fullname: Special Topics
info: Special Topics in Rhetoric.

subject: RHUM
name: Technology, Self, and Society
fullname: Technology, Self, and Society
info: Culture of technology. Social/personal meanings technology holds. Issues of power, work, identity, and our relation to nature. Mass production/consumption, industrialization of agriculture, changes in art/design, effects of modern transportation/communication technologies.

subject: RHUM
name: Internet Comm:Tools and Issues
fullname: Internet Communication: Tools and Issues
info: Current/developing tools of internet-based communication. Concepts of e-mail, usenet news, mailing lists, Web-based chats, MOOs, and internet relay chat. Emphasizes technology examination, assessment of information delivered, and criteria development for information dissemination.

subject: RHUM
name: Tech & Professional Writing
fullname: Technical and Professional Writing
info: Written/oral communication in professional settings. Gathering information, analyzing audience, assessing conventional formats. Drafting, testing, revising documents. Oral presentation of final reports.

subject: RHUM
name: Project Design and Dev I
fullname: Project Design and Development I
info: Introduction to design principles, visual display of data, and management of publications (e.g., newsletters, brochures, scientific posters). Computer software to aid in design and in project management. Two-semester sequence.

subject: RHUM
name: Project Management & Design II
fullname: Principles and Application of Project Management & Design II
info: Second course in sequence, following 3671.  Students study, plan, research, design, and develop technical communication print documents, including documentation, brochures, and newsletters. Introduction to workplace project processes. Emphasizes developing production-quality documents.

subject: RHUM
name: Rhet Theory & Sci & Tech Comm
fullname: Rhetorical Theory and Scientific and Technical Communication
info: Principles/history of rhetorical theory/criticism. Emphasizes classical theories, especially "Aristotle's Rhetoric." Applying Aristotelian concepts to examples of contemporary communication. Relationship of classical theory to scientific discourse and to technical communication.

subject: RHUM
name: Corporate Video for Tech Comm
fullname: Corporate Video for Technical Communicators
info: Introduction to products, professionals, and processes of corporate video.  Students analyze corporate video; submit a proposal, treatment and script; maintain a journal; complete an interactive unit on production; and conduct research on a video-related topic of their choice.

subject: RHUM
name: Managerial & Organization Comm
fullname: Managerial and Organizational Communication, Planning, and Change
info: Emphasizes action research in scientific or technical settings. Organization/management theory for consultative tasks.

subject: RHUM
name: Internship in Sci & Tech Comm
fullname: Internship in Scientific and Technical Communication
info: Internship sites may include the University, industry, or government agencies.  An internship proposal, progress report, internship journal (optional), and final report with letter from the internship supervisor is required.

subject: RHUM
name: Usability Testing
fullname: Usability and Human Factors in Technical Communication
info: Principles/concepts of human factors/usability testing. Text-based, expert-based, reader-based, and prototype-based user testing. Developing objectives, criteria, and measures. Conducting tests in lab, field, and virtual environments. Using software programs to analyze qualitative/quantitative data.

subject: RHUM
name: Editing/Style for Tech Comm
fullname: Editing and Style for Technical Communicators
info: Editorial process, levels of style, ethical considerations. Cohesion, clarity, coherence, organization, audience. Writer-editor relationship. Editor's marks. Copyright issues.

subject: RHUM
name: Writing Prop and Grant Mgmt
fullname: Writing Proposals and Grant Management
info: Research funding sources. Interpreting an RFP or program announcement. Letters of intent. Grant preparation following guidelines of an RFP or program announcement. Proposals for nonprofits or research or business proposals. Uses Microft Project.

subject: RHUM
name: Emerging Tech in Communication
fullname: Emerging Technologies in Technical Communication
info: Focus on creating multimedia, hypertext, online help, and Internet documents.  Learn linear & nonliner design; linking; reading and editing online.  Principles of technical communication taught through projetcs; scripts, online support, and using mark-up language.

subject: RHUM
name: Message Design:Theory & Prac I
fullname: Message Design: Theory and Practice I
info: Audience analysis, media selection, message design through various theoretical perspectives, including cognitive/schema, social construction, feminist, intercultural theories. Usability testing, contextual inquiry as means to study effectiveness of messages.

subject: RHUM
name: Message Design II
fullname: Message Design: Theory and Practice II
info: Political, economic, social, and technical dimensions of media selection and message design.  Apply theories of message design and media selection to an online design project.  Media analyses, scripts, budgets, treatments, project design plans, and various interactive screens.

subject: RHUM
name: Info Gathering Tech: STC
fullname: Information-Gathering Techniques in Scientific and Technical Communication
info: Questionnaire development, informational interviewing, focus group interviewing. Guides, schedules, questioning techniques, communication theories in employment cycle interviews. Descriptive statistics used to analyze data.

subject: RHUM
name: Research in Sci & Tech Comm
fullname: Research in Scientific and Technical Communication
info: Experimental and survey research techniques for both quantitative and qualitative methodolgies in Scientific and Technical Communication.  Face-to-face, telephone and focus group interviewing; questionnaire development; contextual inquiry; using rating, ranking and q-sort methods.  Ethics, experiemental bias, and inferential statistical analysis will be discussed.

subject: RHUM
name: Theo & Prac:Intern'l Bus Comm
fullname: Theory and Practice in International Business Communication
info: International, intercultural scientific, technical, and business communication. Cultural differences studied through metaphors/research, interviews of people from other cultures (e.g., international business managers), and case studies.
